SENT.plain: Health care providers and patients have lots of choice to treat type 2 diabetes, but the blood glucose improvement is limited
The one therapy with unlimited potential (at least theoretically) is insulin
Many studies show that glucose control is achievable with insulin safely in most patients with type 2 diabetes
Effective diabetes management at the primary care or specialty level requires a belief in the importance of insulin therapy in uncontrolled patients with type 2 diabetes
This review details the theories, observed outcomes, and how-tos regarding insulin use in type 2 diabetes
